description: Join South East London Community Energy for a walking tour of three community energy sites and a workshop on how community energy can help future-proof our city.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: South East London Community Energy (Selce) is a member led cooperative founded in 2014 by a group of local people who believed that everyone should have access to affordable, clean energy.
We raise money for renewable energy projects through community share offers. People who invest in our projects know they are helping save CO2 emissions and lowering energy bills.
We collaborate with residents, businesses, and organisations to develop projects that help us achieve this vision.

Currently our work focuses on four main strands:
•     community owned solar
•     LED retrofit for community buildings
•     energy Advice for people struggling to pay their bills
•     practical advice and support for people who want to retrofit their homes.

factsheet.heading: On the Day
paragraphs: We’ll start with a walking tour of three sites that have benefitted from community energy. Two local schools that have had solar panels installed (from street-level as we can’t accommodate roof access for visitors) and one community centre that has had all of their lighting systems upgraded.
Members of our solar, retrofit and energy advice team will then facilitate a workshop on how community energy can help future-proof our city.

images.title: Our directors and the Lord Mayor of Greenwich on the roof of Mulgrave School

location.address: Greenwich station, Greenwich High Road, SE10 8JQ
travel_info: Tube: Cutty Sark, Deptford Bridge, Greenwich
Additional travel info: We will meet at St John's Station, and walk to two of our solar sites and finish at G-West Community & Arts Centre.

name: South East London Community Energy - Walking Tour
